alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued June 25 at 4:43PM MST until June 25 at 5:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... East central Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... * Until 545 PM MST. * At 443 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Dateland to 15 miles southwest of Gila Bend to 6 miles south of Gila Bend Auxiliary Field to near Big Horn, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 58 and 142. AZ Route 238 between mile markers 1 and 30. AZ Route 85 between mile markers 1 and 20, and between mile markers 119 and 131. Locations impacted include... Gila Bend, Estrella, Sentinel, Paloma, Freeman, Big Horn, Gila Bend Auxiliary Field, Dateland, Bosque, Cotton Center, Sonoran National Monument and Hyder. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
